edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2

Class AceCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.Card
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.AceCard

  • public class AceCard
extends Card
    Author:
    David Scianni. The AceCard class is a subclass of Card. It is its own class because it is the only card that can change its value, and should be the only card that is allowed to change its value.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.Assignment2.Card

        value

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AceCard(int s)
      The AceCard constructor will call the Card constructor and send it the Card.cardNumber 1 representing the Ace, and the parameter s which represents the suit that is called.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeAceValue()
      This method is placed so that when an AceCard calls the method, the one in AceCard will override this one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AceCard

        public AceCard(int s)
        The AceCard constructor will call the Card constructor and send it the Card.cardNumber 1 representing the Ace, and the parameter s which represents the suit that is called.
        Parameters:
        s - is the suit that AceCard will send to the Card constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • changeAceValue

        public void changeAceValue()
        Description copied from class: Card
        This method is placed so that when an AceCard calls the method, the one in AceCard will override this one. It is empty so that if a non AceCard Card tries to call it it will do nothing. The AceCard changeAceValue method changes the value to 1. This can be used for when the ace is causing the Character to bust, so that it will change its value to 1 instead of 11 to help out the Character.
        Overrides:
        changeAceValue in class Card
